conversion_verification.notes: Second image is a true cutaway 3D model with extruded walls, visible thickness, angled/isometric viewpoint, and ceiling removed to expose interior volumes.

3d_conversion_fundamentals.notes: Clear wall height/thickness and readable room volumes; good corner geometry and cutaway. Minor simplification of some junctions/openings and limited detail on top-of-wall surfaces.

geometric_accuracy.notes: Overall apartment massing and main zones (bedroom, living/dining, kitchen, toilet) broadly match, but the 2D plan's utility area and balcony are not clearly represented as distinct spaces, and several wall/door/window placements appear simplified vs the plan.

interior_elements.notes: Bedroom bed/wardrobe, living seating/TV, dining table, kitchen counters/appliances, and bathroom fixtures are present and generally placed in plausible rooms; some elements are generic and not tightly aligned to the 2D plan's exact arrangement.

visual_clarity.notes: Clean render with good readability of walls/floors/openings and no UI/text contamination; lighting is even. Some ambiguity remains around missing/merged minor spaces (utility/balcony) due to minimal detailing.

detected_errors.description: Utility room (and balcony as a distinct exterior space) from the 2D plan are not clearly modeled as separate areas in the 3D cutaway.
Several internal partition extents and adjacency transitions (kitchen/foyer/utility edge conditions) appear simplified or altered compared to the 2D wall layout.
Door/window counts and exact wall locations do not fully match the 2D plan; openings are approximated.

summary: This is a genuine 3D cutaway conversion with strong volumetric read, but it loses layout fidelity by omitting or merging smaller plan spaces (notably utility/balcony) and simplifying openings/partitions.
